title: usingRecursiveAssertion() field !=null-check fails for byte[] (java) / ByteArray(kotlin)

labels.name: theme: recursive comparison
labels.description: An issue related to the recursive comparison

body:
**Describe the bug**
Verifying that a field of type byte[] is not null fails with `IllegalArgumentException: Given object null is not an array` when using both` .hasNoNullFields()` and `.allFieldsSatisfy(o -> o != null);`. Both for byte[] in java and ByteArray in Kotlin.

* assertj core version: 3.24.2
* java version: java/11.0.16.1-tem/
* test framework version: junit-jupiter-api 5.9.2
* os (if relevant): Both linux and windows

**Test case reproducing the bug**

Add a test case showing the bug that we can run

```java
package org.example;

import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
import static org.assertj.core.api.Assertions.*;

class TestCase{
    class Outer{
        Inner inner = new Inner();
        byte[] byteArrayOuter = null;
    }

    class Inner{
        byte[] byteArray = null;
    }

    /**
     * Fails as expected with:
     *  Expecting
     *  org.example.TestCase$Outer@c03cf28
     *  not to have any null property or field, but "byteArrayOuter" was null.
     */
    @Test
    public void  outerAssertionCompletesWithExpectedAssertionError(){
        assertThat(new Outer()).hasNoNullFieldsOrProperties();
    }

    /**
     * Fails with the following error:
     * /home/oyvasb/.sdkman/candidates/java/11.0.16.1-tem/bin/java -ea -Didea.test.cyclic.buffer.size=1048576 -javaagent:/snap/intellij-idea-ultimate/426/lib/idea_rt.jar=42217:/snap/intellij-idea-ultimate/426/bin -Dfile.encoding=UTF-8 -classpath /home/oyvasb/.m2/repository/org/junit/platform/junit-platform-launcher/1.9.2/junit-platform-launcher-1.9.2.jar:/home/oyvasb/.m2/repository/org/junit/platform/junit-platform-engine/1.9.2/junit-platform-engine-1.9.2.jar:/home/oyvasb/.m2/repository/org/junit/jupiter/junit-jupiter-engine/5.9.2/junit-jupiter-engine-5.9.2.jar:/snap/intellij-idea-ultimate/426/lib/idea_rt.jar:/snap/intellij-idea-ultimate/426/plugins/junit/lib/junit5-rt.jar:/snap/intellij-idea-ultimate/426/plugins/junit/lib/junit-rt.jar:/home/oyvasb/kode/assertj-nullcheckerror/target/test-classes:/home/oyvasb/kode/assertj-nullcheckerror/target/classes:/home/oyvasb/.m2/repository/org/junit/jupiter/junit-jupiter-api/5.9.2/junit-jupiter-api-5.9.2.jar:/home/oyvasb/.m2/repository/org/opentest4j/opentest4j/1.2.0/opentest4j-1.2.0.jar:/home/oyvasb/.m2/repository/org/junit/platform/junit-platform-commons/1.9.2/junit-platform-commons-1.9.2.jar:/home/oyvasb/.m2/repository/org/apiguardian/apiguardian-api/1.1.2/apiguardian-api-1.1.2.jar:/home/oyvasb/.m2/repository/org/assertj/assertj-core/3.24.2/assertj-core-3.24.2.jar:/home/oyvasb/.m2/repository/net/bytebuddy/byte-buddy/1.12.21/byte-buddy-1.12.21.jar com.intellij.rt.junit.JUnitStarter -ideVersion5 -junit5 org.example.TestCase,outerAssertionFailsForByteArray

     *

     * 	at org.assertj.core.util.Arrays.asObjectArray(Arrays.java:57)

    public void outerAssertionFailsForByteArray(){
        assertThat(new Outer())
                .usingRecursiveAssertion()
                .hasNoNullFields();
    }

    @Test
    public void innerAssertionFailsForByteArray(){
        assertThat(new Outer())
                .usingRecursiveAssertion()
                .allFieldsSatisfy(o -> o != null);
    }
}
```
